definition: to take a wife/to get married (man)
to take a wife/to marry (a woman)

sentences.english: Middle-aged , he has never married and has a lecherous side.
sentences.chinese: 他雖已中年，但尚末娶妻，特別好色。

sentences.english: To marry a woman for her style is like buying a house for its paint.
sentences.chinese: 由於面貌美麗而娶妻，猶如油漆漂亮而買屋。

sentences.english: "To expand my sect, I am willing to go even to the US to marry", he said.
sentences.chinese: “爲了發揚教派，我還想去美國娶妻”，他說。

sentences.english: Nowadays, monk is a profession. They can get married and have kids, and they are rich!
sentences.chinese: 現在的和尚是職業的，可以娶妻生子，有錢的很。

sentences.english: Thou shalt not take thee a wife, neither shalt thou have sons or daughters in this place.
sentences.chinese: 你在這地方不可娶妻，生兒養女。

sentences.english: So as a man may have a quarrel to marry, when he will.
sentences.chinese: 所以一個人只要他願意，任何時候都有娶妻的理由。

sentences.english: He that has a wife has a master.
They discuss the housing price problem, This generation won't find a spouse.
sentences.chinese: 他們講着房價的問題，嫁人娶妻要隔代。

sentences.english: Judah got a wife for Er, his firstborn, and her name was Tamar.
sentences.chinese: 猶大爲長子珥娶妻，名叫他瑪。

sentences.english: Four xi listened to her more say more exaggerated, quickly said he has a wife.
sentences.chinese: 四喜聽她越說越誇張，急忙說自己已經娶妻了。

sentences.english: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn， whose name was Tamar.
sentences.chinese: 猶大爲長子珥娶妻，名叫他瑪。

sentences.english: If a man marry a wife, and afterwards hate her.
sentences.chinese: 若有人娶妻，與她結合後就憎惡她。

sentences.english: They discuss the housing price problem, and this generation won't find a spouse.
sentences.chinese: 他們講着房價的問題，嫁人娶妻要隔代。

sentences.english: He that have a wife have a master.
Despite protests from his family they get married and start a small business together.
sentences.chinese: 儘管他的家人，他們娶妻生子小企業一起抗議。

sentences.english: Master Lin Ming first took a wife, bride is missing on the night.
sentences.chinese: 林家少爺明通第一次娶妻，當晚新娘子就失蹤。

definition: to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
to take a wife/to marry (a woman)
to settle down and get married (of a man)/to become a recognized expert
to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
